results.title: Pouches rule OK!
results.creator_credit: Richard Corfield and ABC-TV (Australia). Science Unit
results.brief_description: Reporter Geoffrey Burchfield describes an exciting new fossil discovery in central Queensland raises interesting questions about the status on Australia in the evolution of life on earth.

results.title: Fat pizza
results.creator_credit: Paul Fenech, Tanith Carroll, Fat Pizza and Village Roadshow Pictures
results.brief_description: This Australian comedy, based on the SBS television show “Pizza”, has an irreverent anarchic flavour that is certain to (intentionally) offend. Pauly (Paul Fenech) is a pizza delivery boy who works for the explosively bad-tempered Bobo (Johnny Boxer); Pauly’s other main occupation is to drive about in his souped-up car, with its blaring sub-woofer stereo; meanwhile his friends Sleek (Paul Nakad), and Davo (Jabba) similarly cruise around in their own customised vehicle, encountering violent cops and sexually eager women. Fans of the series will recognise the vigour with which writer Fenech attacks sacred cows of Australian culture - principally, but not exclusively, the young male Lebanese/Australian racial stereotype - whilst applying a thick layer of infantile machismo and t&a humour. Certainly not to the taste of all, but quite original and daring in both concept and execution. Cast also incudes Annalise Braakensiek with cameos by Merv Hughes, Tim Ferguson, Jeff Fenech, Shane Porteous, Red Symons, Bernard King and Kamahl.

results.title: Fat of the land
results.creator_credit: Baptist Pork Production in association with Civilian Tragedy
results.brief_description: A compilation of short British ‘art-house’ films 1984-1987 as follows: “Procar” (dirs. Richard Heslop, Daniel Landin), A Nosegay” (dir. Maggie Jailler), “Thou pluckest me out screaming (dir. Daniel Landin), “Epiphany (excerpt)” (dir. Certh Wyn Evens), “The Sluggard” (dir. Joy Perino), “Language” (dir. Richard Heslop), “Less then useless” (dirs. Richard Heslop, Carrie Kirkpatrick) and “The Conversation” (dirs. Timothy Burke, Richard Heslop)

results.title: Fat freedom
results.creator_credit: Richard Capaner, Derek Lamb and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Using soft washes of colour, this animated film portrays a man’s desire to escape his heavy human body, changing it into forms that let him fly, dance and rejoice and allow him to express his inner needs and fantasies. Music by Ben Low.

results.title: Family reactions
results.creator_credit: Tim Abbott, Helen Edwards, Tony Shaddock and Dept of Health, Richmond Implementation Unit
results.brief_description: Designed to provide the intellectual disability residential care worker with an insight into what it means to be part of a family that includes a child with developmental disabilities, an understanding of the grieving process and how families cope, an appreciation of the needs of different families, to learn ways of interacting positively with parents, to examine methods of developing effective partnerships with parents and most importantly develop an appreciation of the uniqueness of families and their reactions. Accompanied by 44p. in-service training manual.

results.title: Family circles
results.creator_credit: Morten Parker, Gudrun Parker, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Shows how the interplay of home and school influences the development of children. The experiences of three children illustrate vividly how parental indifference, lack of imagination, and emotional conflict at home can destroy the confidence and enthusiasm necessary for a child’s success at school. (Awards: Cleveland; Toronto; Montevideo)

results.title: Fashion: a 'Frost's Century' episode
results.creator_credit: David Weiland, Robyn Wallis, Simon Welfare, Granite Productions and Reuters Television
results.brief_description: A detailed exploration of twentieth century clothing design, documented through extensive archival footage and interviews with numerous fashion identities, including British designer Katherine Hamnett, and editor of British Vogue, Alexandra Schulman. The design analysis contextualises historical, cultural, social and political influences on the development of fashion, and traverses a wide array of subjects including fashion and the war, innovations and trends, fashion designers, the supermodel phenomena and gender differences in fashion and professional modelling. This detailed documentary is presented in four parts. Narrated by Sir David Frost.

results.title: Far out kids animation
results.creator_credit: Anthony Lucas, Paul Williams, Peter Nicholson and Steve French
results.brief_description: The AFI put together this compilation of Australian animated films suitable for children under nine. It includes: “There’s Dragons” - a funny film about a silly dragon, “That’s Progress” - a young boy doing a school project on historic buildings is constantly thwarted by Mr Progress, who keeps demolishing the buildings to put up car parks, “The Lighthouse Made Three” a whimsical love story based on a popular song. “Thumpalong” about a king who hates music, and “DuDu and the Line”, a celebration of the wild and free flowing transformations available to the animator.

results.title: Fantasy of feet
results.creator_credit: Frederic Goodich, Warren Brown and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Shows scenes of feet walking, dancing, running, and jumping, barefooted and in sandals, flippers, slippers and boots to encourage children to think about the different kinds of shoes and how feet serve their many functions. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Fantasy man
results.creator_credit: John Meagher, Basil Appleby, Darrell Lass and Centaur Enterprises
results.brief_description: Mid-life crisis, bored with work, his wife and his life, Nick Bailey (Harold Hopkins) begins to fantasize about the young and rather attractive Donna (Kerry Mack), who works at the hamburger stand near his office. Nick’s wife Liz (Jeanie Drynan) confused and disturbed by Nick’s strange and secretive behaviour, especially his long showers, finds herself fantasizing about a former lover after a chance meeting. Can their marriage survive? Does anyone care? A low-budget film with a pretty ordinary plot. Cast also features Kate Fitzpatrick.
